availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, liquor merchant. Native of Hanover, Germany. Married Lizzie Jacobs Finck in 1858. Father of six children. Master Mason in Willis Stewart Lodge. Founded the Western Insurance Bank and served as President. Helped establish the German-English Academy, the Orphans' Society, the Protestant German Orphan Asylum. Served as director of Southern Mutual Life Insurance Company.

ab.bibl:
“C. Henry Finck Dead,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), October 15, 1878, p. 4.
Henry Tanner, ed., Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 87.
"Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954," database with images, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:Q2QD-8C7L : accessed 25 October 2017), C. Henry Finck and Lizzie Jacobs, 11 Feb 1858; citing Louisville, Jefferson, Kentucky, United States, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond; FHL microfilm 482,708.
